content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

Algorithm parameters are as follows.
DC: Average person
ILT: Medium-High

The passage is provided in the following message

Derived from the classic image classification algorithms, our classifier has been constructed in the form of a fast 39-layered Inception model, that evaluates the presence of roads using the tomographic reconstructions of the input frames.

FKGL score of the latest passage version is 19.48. Identify which parts of the passage are the most complex. Based on this information, identify the complexity of the passage. Is determined complexity higher than DC (Average person)? Answer "Yes" or "No"

The FKGL (Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level) score of 19.48 indicates that the passage is written at a high school senior or college freshman level. 

The most complex parts of the passage are:
- "fast 39-layered Inception model"
- "tomographic reconstructions of the input frames"

These phrases contain technical terms and complex vocabulary that contribute to the high FKGL score. 

The complexity of the passage is high. Yes, it is higher than DC (Average person).

Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Simplify this section, and remember to respect the ILT (Medium-High) contraint. Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage. Only provide the reincorporated version

The complicated section is: "fast 39-layered Inception model, that evaluates the presence of roads using the tomographic reconstructions of the input frames."

Simplification: 
The complicated section can be simplified to: "a fast model that uses images to detect roads"

This simplification maintains the core idea of the original section but uses more accessible language. The information loss is relatively low, and the severity is acceptable under the ILT constraint. 

Reincorporated passage:
Our classifier has been constructed in the form of a fast model that uses images to detect roads.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences. What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium-High)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

The simplified passage loses information about the classifier being derived from a classic image classification algorithm and the specific architecture of the model (39-layered Inception model). The severity of this information loss is High. The severity level is High. Yes
